name: Park House Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights with a couple of friends.All were happy about the hotel.
reviews.title: A great experience in the heart of Galway

reviews.text: The rooms are quiet,spacious and very clean.Our rate included breakfast,which was a good idea,because it was excellent.The service including the valet parking was exceptionally good.
reviews.title: Trip to Galway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is a dream,it is right in the heart of Galway with lots of pubs and restaurants in walking distance.We will definitely come back.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at Park House Hotel. It is conveniently located betwen the train station and bus terminal near Eyre Square in the middle of town. The room we stayed in was recently remodeled and completely up to date. We had probably twice the space in our room at Park House than we had at either of the hotels we stayed in elsewhere in Ireland, with all the amenities you could ask for. While the hotel is conveniently located, which means there are plenty of pubs nearby, it was quiet at night. The hotel has an excellent restaurant and a bar, if you choose to be more casual. And the best of all of this is the staff was helpful and courteous. We would love to come back and stay again.
reviews.title: Star Rated Hotel
Elegant hotel in terrific location
reviews.text: The hotel was great. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and the location of the hotel was central. I highly recommend it.

We stayed here just for one night the end of March...We were a group of 6 needing 3 rooms which we got a great rate by booking in advance on the website-no breakfast included in our rate but there was coffee and tea available in our rooms. We arrived in Galway at noon and took a chance that our rooms would be ready-even though we were very early. Two out of 3 rooms were available which was great as we could leave our belongings behind and explore the city! The bathrooms had heated towel racks which was a surprise bonus that we loved. Would stay again for sure! Location was great too-we could walk to pubs and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Location!
Review of restaurant
reviews.text: We just had Easter Sunday lunch here. The restaurant was packed, so much so that although we had booked some time ago we ended up in an overflow lobby type room.

The starters were very ordinary to be honest - clearly plated in advance. The main courses were very good. Three of us had the stuffed duckling legs and one person had salmon. We were all more than delighted with the main course. The desserts were again very ordinary - more or less thrown on the plate or into the bowl as I would do at home although they tasted well.
reviews.title: Rude staff. Awful, never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Serve was a little erratic - our main waitress was definitely a sub. The wine, a Malbec 2010, was fine although a 2008 was listed in the wine menu. The change of vintage was notified to me by the waiter. Strangely, for Easter Sunday there was no lamb on the menu! Overall a satisfying meal but for the price we paid I would not have expected some of the corners that were clearly being cut.
reviews.title: A hotel to return too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad place to stay in general although the location is fantastic. The room was clean although very basic. Felt like a budget hotel with the cheap furniture and bad customer service except the prices are anything but! At breakfast there was a very pushie, fake friendly, head waitress or maby supervisor 'talk lady with dark hair and a suit' who insisted on interrupting about 3 times along with the waitress another 2 times just to check was everything ok!! We had lunch in the restaurant one of the days only to find athe food was slaped up and tasted like it was just flung onto the plate without any tlc given to cool it. Despite all this we said we would give dinner a chance as we heard it was supposed to be good, and to be fair the food was nice and our waitress was genuine but the man who greeted us when we arrived was just simply rude. I believe his name was John. He made me feel like i never left work and my boss was still beside me shouting the odds. After my experience as a whole i will never return or recommend this hotel to anybody. Awful, avoid at all costs.
reviews.title: A two day stop-over in Galway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we entered the Hotel we were made feel that we were the most important
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: people staying. As for the service and attention to detail at breakfast I have never come
reviews.title: top class hotel

reviews.text: across the care just nothing was too much trouble................Awonderfully enjoyable few
reviews.title: comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: days spent in Galway.
reviews.title: great irish welcome

reviews.text: we stayed for 3nights at easter a very clean and comfortable hotel,staff were very helpful and
reviews.title: Nicest staff, lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we checked in we were delighted with this lovely hotel. Staff were so very helpful printing off bus timetables, giving good advice about places to visit and generally letting us know that they were there to look after our every wish.
reviews.title: Irish hospitality at its best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food at breakfast was first class with lots of lovely freshly-squeezed juice,fruit salad,fresh fruit and beautiful home made bread.We had the fish option and it was a lovely fillet of plaice. We were asked if we'd like a second fillet! Dinner was a feast of great Irish ingredients cooked to perfection and a good wine list covering a wide range of well-priced wines. Our waiter,Jonathan, was just the best . Likewise,Ruairi , the porter who gave us some good advice when we asked about Spiddal his home village and was very helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money and very good location; if car, book with free parking included

reviews.text: Our bedroom was large and spacious and very nicely furnished.We had a double bed and a single bed in our room 221 . Beds were very comfortable and the room which was at the back of the hotel was quiet.A big bathroom with full-size bath and power shower and good quality toiletries and a huge mirror made ablutions a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and excellent value - why stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: Best of all were the staff throughout the hotel .Did I mention the bar staff who were so efficient?
reviews.title: Great venue

reviews.text: A lovely place to stay if you are in Galway and situated right beside Eyre Square so you can park your car and enjoy all that wonderful city has to offer right on your doorstep. The railway station and Bus station are beside the hotel so if you want to travel further afield you can use public transport.
reviews.title: Wonderful trip!

description: Park House Hotel, Galway is conveniently located in the heart of Galway's city centre, with private secure car-parking on the grounds of the hotel. The hotel blends the warmth and personality of a boutique hotel with the style and luxury of a contemporary 4 Star international hotel. Guest accommodation comprises of 84 rooms divided into superior & deluxe rooms, suites and serviced apartments. The award-winning Park Restaurant is a favourite with locals and guests.
